[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@here/harp-mapview](./harp-mapview.md) &gt; [DataSource](./harp-mapview.datasource.md)

## DataSource class

Derive a class from `DataSource` to contribute data and geometries to the \[\[MapView\]\].

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare abstract class DataSource extends THREE.EventDispatcher 
```

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(options)](./harp-mapview.datasource._constructor_.md) |  | Constructs a new <code>DataSource</code>. |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [addGroundPlane](./harp-mapview.datasource.addgroundplane.md) |  | boolean | Whether the datasource should have a ground plane (this plane covers the tile entirely and has the minimum possible renderOrder), this can be required in some cases when fallback parent tiles need to be covered by the children, otherwise the content will overlap. Default is false |
|  [allowOverlappingTiles](./harp-mapview.datasource.allowoverlappingtiles.md) |  | boolean |  |
|  [cacheable](./harp-mapview.datasource.cacheable.md) |  | boolean | Set to <code>true</code> if the \[\[MapView\]\] can cache tiles produced by this <code>DataSource</code>. |
|  [enabled](./harp-mapview.datasource.enabled.md) |  | boolean | Set to <code>true</code> if this <code>DataSource</code> is enabled; <code>false</code> otherwise. |
|  [mapView](./harp-mapview.datasource.mapview.md) |  | [MapView](./harp-mapview.mapview.md) | The \[\[MapView\]\] that is holding this <code>DataSource</code>. |
|  [maxDataLevel](./harp-mapview.datasource.maxdatalevel.md) |  | number | The maximum zoom level at which data is available. |
|  [maxDisplayLevel](./harp-mapview.datasource.maxdisplaylevel.md) |  | number | The maximum zoom level at which \[\[DataSource\]\] is displayed. |
|  [maxGeometryHeight](./harp-mapview.datasource.maxgeometryheight.md) |  | number | Maximum geometry height above ground level this <code>DataSource</code> can produce.<!-- -->Used in first stage of frustum culling before \[\[Tile.maxGeometryHeight\]\] data is available. 0. |
|  [maxZoomLevel](./harp-mapview.datasource.maxzoomlevel.md) |  | number | The maximum zoom level at which data is available or displayed at (depending on \[\[DataSource\]\] subclass). |
|  [minDataLevel](./harp-mapview.datasource.mindatalevel.md) |  | number | The minimum zoom level at which data is available. |
|  [minDisplayLevel](./harp-mapview.datasource.mindisplaylevel.md) |  | number | The minimum zoom level at which \[\[DataSource\]\] is displayed. |
|  [minZoomLevel](./harp-mapview.datasource.minzoomlevel.md) |  | number | The minimum zoom level at which data is available or displayed at (depending on \[\[DataSource\]\] subclass). |
|  [name](./harp-mapview.datasource.name.md) |  | string | The unique name of a <code>DataSource</code> instance. |
|  [projection](./harp-mapview.datasource.projection.md) |  | [Projection](./harp-geoutils.projection.md) | The \[\[Projection\]\] used by the \[\[MapView\]\] that is holding this <code>DataSource</code>.<!-- -->An <code>Error</code> is thrown if you call this method before this <code>DataSource</code> has been added to a \[\[MapView\]\]. |
|  [storageLevelOffset](./harp-mapview.datasource.storageleveloffset.md) |  | number | The difference between storage level and display level of tile.<!-- -->Storage level offset is a value applied (added) to current zoom level giving a final tile level being displayed. This way we may differentate current zoom level from the storage level that is displayed, giving fine grained control over the tiles being decoded an displayed. |
|  [styleSetName](./harp-mapview.datasource.stylesetname.md) |  | string \| undefined | Returns the name of the \[\[StyleSet\]\] to use for the decoding. |
|  [useGeometryLoader](./harp-mapview.datasource.usegeometryloader.md) |  | boolean | Set to <code>true</code> if the loader should be used to get the tile contents. |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [attach(mapView)](./harp-mapview.datasource.attach.md) |  | This method is called when this <code>DataSource</code> is added to a \[\[MapView\]\].<!-- -->Reimplementations of this method must invoke the definition of the super class. |
|  [canGetTile(zoomLevel, tileKey)](./harp-mapview.datasource.cangettile.md) |  | Returns <code>true</code> if \[\[DataSource\]\] can load tile with given \[\[TileKey\]\] and zoom level. |
|  [clearCache()](./harp-mapview.datasource.clearcache.md) |  | Purges all the caching done by this <code>DataSource</code> |
|  [clearFeatureState()](./harp-mapview.datasource.clearfeaturestate.md) |  | Clears the state of all the features of this \[\[DataSource\]\]. |
|  [connect()](./harp-mapview.datasource.connect.md) |  | This method is called when the <code>DataSource</code> is added to a \[\[MapView\]\]. Reimplement this method to provide any custom initialization, such as, to establish a network connection, or to initialize complex data structures. |
|  [detach(mapView)](./harp-mapview.datasource.detach.md) |  | This method is called when this <code>DataSource</code> is removed from a \[\[MapView\]\].<!-- -->Reimplementations of this method must invoke the definition of the super class. |
|  [dispose()](./harp-mapview.datasource.dispose.md) |  | Destroys this <code>DataSource</code>. |
|  [getDataZoomLevel(zoomLevel)](./harp-mapview.datasource.getdatazoomlevel.md) |  | Computes the data zoom level to use. |
|  [getFeatureState(featureId)](./harp-mapview.datasource.getfeaturestate.md) |  | Gets the state of the given feature id. |
|  [getTile(tileKey)](./harp-mapview.datasource.gettile.md) |  | This method is called when \[\[MapView\]\] needs to visualize or preload the content of a \[\[TileKey\]\]. |
|  [getTilingScheme()](./harp-mapview.datasource.gettilingscheme.md) |  | Returns the \[\[TilingScheme\]\] used by this <code>DataSource</code>. |
|  [isFullyCovering()](./harp-mapview.datasource.isfullycovering.md) |  | Boolean which says whether a \[\[DataSource\]\] produces tiles that fully cover the tile, i.e. tiles underneath are completely hidden. Must be overriden for \[\[DataSource\]\]'s that don't have a ground plane, but which still fully cover the tile, e.g. web tiles. |
|  [isVisible(zoomLevel)](./harp-mapview.datasource.isvisible.md) |  | Returns <code>true</code> if \[\[DataSource\]\] should be displayed for the zoom level. |
|  [ready()](./harp-mapview.datasource.ready.md) |  | Returns <code>true</code> if this <code>DataSource</code> is ready and the \[\[MapView\]\] can invoke <code>getTile()</code> to start requesting data. |
|  [removeFeatureState(featureId)](./harp-mapview.datasource.removefeaturestate.md) |  | Removes the state associated to the given feature. |
|  [requestUpdate()](./harp-mapview.datasource.requestupdate.md) |  | Sends a request to the \[\[MapView\]\] to redraw the scene. |
|  [setEnableElevationOverlay(enable)](./harp-mapview.datasource.setenableelevationoverlay.md) |  | Enables or disables overlay of geometry on elevation. It must be overloaded by data sources supporting this feature. |
|  [setFeatureState(featureId, state)](./harp-mapview.datasource.setfeaturestate.md) |  | Sets the state of the given feature id.
```typescript
dataSource.setFeatureState(featureId, { enabled: true });

```
 |
|  [setLanguages(languages)](./harp-mapview.datasource.setlanguages.md) |  | Used to configure the languages used by the <code>DataSource</code> according to priority; the first language in the array has the highest priority. |
|  [setPoliticalView(pov)](./harp-mapview.datasource.setpoliticalview.md) |  | Used to express different country point of view (political view). Set to <code>undefined</code> (or empty string) if you want to reset to default point of view. |
|  [setStyleSet(styleSet, definitions, languages)](./harp-mapview.datasource.setstyleset.md) |  | Invoked by \[\[MapView\]\] to notify when the \[\[Theme\]\] has been changed.<!-- -->If <code>DataSource</code> depends on a <code>styleSet</code> or <code>languages</code>, it must update its tiles' geometry.<!-- -->@<!-- -->deprecated, Use \[\[setTheme\]\]. |
|  [setTheme(theme, languages)](./harp-mapview.datasource.settheme.md) |  | Apply the \[\[Theme\]\] to this data source.<!-- -->If <code>DataSource</code> depends on a <code>styleSet</code> defined by this theme or <code>languages</code>, it must update its tiles' geometry. |
|  [shouldPreloadTiles()](./harp-mapview.datasource.shouldpreloadtiles.md) |  | This method is called by the \[\[MapView\]\] to determine if the content of the surrounding tiles must be preloaded. |
|  [shouldRenderText(zoomLevel, tileKey)](./harp-mapview.datasource.shouldrendertext.md) |  | Returns <code>true</code> if \[\[MapView\]\] should render the text elements with the given \[\[TileKey\]\] and zoom level.<!-- -->This is an additional check for the tiles that are already selected for rendering so the default implementation returns <code>true</code>. |
|  [shouldSubdivide(zoomLevel, tileKey)](./harp-mapview.datasource.shouldsubdivide.md) |  | Returns <code>true</code> if \[\[MapView\]\] should traverse tiles further with given \[\[TileKey\]\] and zoom level. |
|  [updateTile(tile)](./harp-mapview.datasource.updatetile.md) |  | This method is called by \[\[MapView\]\] before the tile needs to be updated, for example after a theme change. |
